title: Keep Banning Me, I'll Keep Making Accounts
body:
Good job riot, you just 14 day suspended my 22nd account, and permabanned all my others.
Keep banning players for flaming in a competitive game.

I hate the whole entire 'thats toxic' mantra every single NA solo q player adapts like they cant handle a single word directed towards them.
I would love to rip into all of my teammates even if they did nothing and really give them the worst experience possible, and I should be allowed to.

Whatever, I'll just make another account and do the same thing again.
downvote this post, doesn't change my outlook

replies.body: wonder how many you'll make before Riot draws the line and straight up ID bans you like they did with Tyler?

> [{quoted}](name=Inkling Commando,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EIze2TE9,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-03-12T05:41:22.185+0000)
>
> wonder how many you'll make before Riot draws the line and straight up ID bans you like they did with Tyler?

That only worked because Tyler streamed and was a big name. You can't exactly ID ban a nobody that has no way to be easily identified as the same person.

> [{quoted}](name=Dynikus,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EIze2TE9,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2019-03-12T05:44:03.350+0000)
>
> That only worked because Tyler streamed and was a big name. You can't exactly ID ban a nobody that has no way to be easily identified as the same person.

Yes you can...

I worked at Amazon.com for a while.

We IP banned people and phone number banned people and CC banned people and address banned people.

And that was like 10 years ago.

IP addresses can be changed within a matter of minutes. VPNs also exist.

 Making a League account doesn't require photo ID, a phone number, an important email (meaning you can just make a throwaway email address), or a home/physical address.

 There is _literally_ no way to IP/ID ban a random person. The only reason it works on notable personalities is because of their ability to be easily recognized.

NA at least doesn't. Doesn't KR or China use SSN (or equivalent)?
The use of the SSN for such a purpose by a private company is illegal, furthermore, not everyone has one for valid reasons.
Which is why I specifically mentioned KR/China and equivalent of SSN. Different laws and whatnot, especially since they try to monitor that kind of stuff.

You need to use your iPin to make an account in Korea. It's not exactly a SSN, but it does make it significantly harder to make multiple accounts.

IP bans are problematic for multiple users that could be under the same IP, and also _incredibly_ easy to get around.

Tyler1 still had a lot of accounts after his ID ban. He got them banned as soon as riot knew he was the account holder, but that didn't stop him from making more.

If anything, it would keep new players away because they wouldn't want to pay to play a game when there are so many other free to play games on the market.

I completely disagree. 

Part of the charm of this game is that you can easily get into, for free. League wouldn't be *nearly* as big as it is, if it were paid. 

And I can say that because when you look at all the other free to play titles to have come out, they all have MUCH bigger playerbases than their paid counterparts. 

Just look at Fortnite. Even if you don't like it, it's indeniably one of the biggest games around. Even beats out games like FIFA.

You're underestimating how much more accesible free-to-play makes the game, and overestimating how much toxicity impacts it.

I was actually asking that "MF is my Waifu" dude. I remember being in a game with him last Season on one of my smurfs. He raged at top/mid for not helping him as he was getting stomped by a botlane Zed. Since I don't particularly care about that account, I called him a few things and got banned for two weeks. It was just memorable because right after I got the banned message, I got an instant feedback one too.

Interesting.

While I can understand the definition of toxic/abusive behavior is vague and that's not cool, if you already lost an account why go through the bother of making more accounts with the sole intent of literally spreading the mental version of HIV? Do you know that negative breeds negative, hurt fosters hurt? If this game is affecting you this much, I hope you decide to take a break, for your sake man. 

Onto the topic however- what is the point of bringing toxic attitudes into the game at all? What does it achieve?

There have been so many times that I am utterly AMAZED at the lack of skill level in high elo master and grandmaster games. To the point where any sane human being would be unable to flame 100+ games unless they literally did not type anything.

These players are a bigger plague than any toxic thing I have ever said across any games. My first account, I had for over 2 years, then when it got permabanned, why would that suddenly encourage me to become a better person?

I kept making more and more accounts, because I literally do not care at this point, and let everything I want to say be released immediately instead of self tilting myself to another dimension by not typing and potentially breaking everything around me. 22 accounts happened like nothing, I can barely even make it to 30 before I get permabanned now to play in high elo.
